name: Doris Bell
text:
This is in response to my son, David Bell's review.  He was upset when I told him that after Answered Prayer finished their service in my home I found several items missing.  Several months later, the missing items were returned to me by someone that I knew and not connected to Answered Prayer.  It was then that I realized that  Answered Prayer had nothing to do with the missing items.  I have apologized to Answered Prayer.  They have responded in a most gracious way and accepted my apology.

Dear      :

I am writing this letter in regards to accusing your employees of theft last year.  I apologize for my mistake.  The items I accused them of taking have been returned to me.

Once again, I apologize to Answered Prayers and these employees for my wrongful accusation and pray that you will forgive me.
Sincerely,

Doris Bell

I had accused back in 2020

resp.text: Thank You So much

name: Susan Stringer
text: Knowing that this home care service is owned locally makes a big difference.  Not only am I happy to support a locally owned agency they are extremely professional and do an amazing job caring for their clients.  The owners are a big part of our community and are real fine folks.  I highly recommend Answered Prayer Home Care.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We sure do appreciate hearing this feedback.

name: Arla Chandler
text: Once again Answered Prayer was a fantastic referral for a family friend. They visited once a week to give the family some time away from the home knowing their loved one was well cared for.  Thank you so much Answered Prayer team for always being the best!

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We sure do appreciate hearing this feedback.

name: Brittany Willis
text: Can not say enough great things about Answered Prayer! The staff is helpful, professional, and companionate. Would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for in-home care!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review. We sure do appreciate hearing this feedback.

name: joan williams
text: In a time when we need consistency for our loved one, this agency has failed to deliver. Workers have no training on the basics from using wheelchairs to attending to basic needs. Workers report late and leave early...even asking to bring their kids along to a work location.  There is a different worker each day which does not give an opportunity for a relationship to develop between client and worker. They take advantage of elderly and/or sick clients if there is no one to advocate for them. I am disappointed. We have been patient, however, our needs have not been met.

resp.text: Thank you for providing constructive feedback that we can share with our team. It is our utmost priority to accommodate  families providing comfort, relief, and reassurance during a challenging time. Our goal is to work with families to create a constructive relationship meant to serve and provide care when families need it most. A member of our management team will be in contact to resolve any communication or service issues that may have occurred.  Thank you again for bringing this matter to our attention. Our management team is available to meet and revise a plan of care always. Please don't hesitate to reach out.

name: David Bell
text: Do not use this company;  we had several items stolen and the company said they would follow up and then stopped responding.  Terrible experience at the worst time possible.  Follow up - I was contacted about the review and Answered Prayer did not wish to make it right (without proof through a police conviction).  If you hire them, make sure your valuables are locked up.

resp.text: Answered Prayer Home Care is a locally owned highly reputable and trusted home care service in the River Region. We thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. As a leader in home care we are bound to a high standard of ethical and moral integrity, prideful of our outstanding caregivers who have been employed without incident for many years.  We place high standards on following protocols at all times.  It is our hope in the future when you or a loved one requires in home care you will consider choosing the integrity of Answered Prayer Home Care Services.

name: Charlotte Cearley
text: So very thankful for Answered Prayer, and Irene.  This group has sent us very qualified and caring folks.  When S had to leave, we were immediately blessed by another caring person, Irene.  So many days, she lifts all our spirits as she lovingly cares for our mom.  Meghann, too, has been invaluable in helping us think things through.  Very grateful for the hard work of this group!

resp.text: Thank you!  We are always trying to do our absolute best.  I will share this with our team.  They will appreciate your kind words.

name: Mandy Beeson
text: Would not recommend! I used this service for less than a year and had to request new caregivers multiple times because of issues with each one. The first one asked to buy all kinds of things from my home, as well as wanting to bring her Internet boyfriend over to meet my mom. Not ok. I don’t think their staff is trained to deal with Alzheimer’s patients and I had one “caregiver” who constantly argued with and agitated my mother. I finally decided that I was done with this company. I paid my last bill and they deposited the check, then tried to send my bill to a collection lawyer! Steer clear of this service!

name: Richard Crabtree
text: Thank you for everything. You guys were great

resp.text: Thank you Richard. We always strive to do our best.  Appreciate your feedback!

name: Del Chick
text: I retracted my negative statement because John White, the owner of the company took care of the situation and was very apologetic, and he will handle the problem for my mother. He said it was a major miscommunication and I’ve accepted  that. You just have to reach out until you get the owner of a company and explain it to them, they’re usually more than helpful, as he has now been.   He Immediately went right out to see my mother! And we have a resolution worked out. Thank you very much John ! 👍

resp.text: UPDATE Hi Del!  We so appreciate working with you and appreciate you reaching out to us.  Have a super day!

name: Peggy Johnson
text: Very comforting to my family.  Was also very professional and companionate in caring to my daughter during the final time of her life.

name: Mandy Beeson
text: Would not recommend! I used this service for less than a year and had to request new caregivers multiple times because of issues with each one. The first one asked to buy all kinds of things from my home, as well as wanting to bring her Internet boyfriend over to meet my mom. Not ok. I don’t think their staff is trained to deal with Alzheimer’s patients and I had one “caregiver” who constantly argued with and agitated my mother. I finally decided that I was done with this company. I paid my last bill and they deposited the check, then tried to send my bill to a collection lawyer! Steer clear of this service!

name: Morgan A
text:
I would not recommend anyone to use this company to help their loved ones. AnswerPrayer is the most disloyal, unprofessional, and unorganized home health company in Alabama.
They also dont give frequent drug screenings to their employees who's out there making mistakes on the job.
Megan Wikof is NOT to be trusted, don't let her poker face fool you!!!

resp.text: Hi Morgan. We are very disappointed to learn of your dissatisfaction with our service provider.  Trust that we are evaluating any dissatisfied feedback that results from interacting with our company.  We will throughly research the comments above and will be sure to handle this with care, accuracy and professionalism.  We strive to always improve and your feedback will be evaluated constructively.  If you have an opportunity to review us again and can improve our rating we would appreciate the evaluation.

name: Carol-Ann Stewart
text:
Synergy Homecare was the perfect agency to support my dad’s stroke recovery. I needed a little extra help each weekday morning while my dad was on home health and his care giver (Brandon) really helped him gain his strength back.

Synergy was very responsive and very easy to work with, I highly recommend this company.

resp.text: Thank you Carol-Ann it was an honor to provide care for your dad.

name: Delaris Juitt
text: The office staff and caregiver are excellent Connie makes sure to provide the right caregiver to their patients.  Also counsel the caregiver on what the patients need.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Juitt. We appreciate you!

name: Jan D
text: The caregivers we had were compassionate and loving. Helpful and caring. They took a load off our minds for sure. Synergy was easy to work with, as well. Thank you so much.

resp.text: Thank you Jan.

name: Tracey Sheets
text: I continue to be impressed by all the staff at Synergy Home Health. Especially Mrs Keisha. I feel like they really care about the patient and as my husband’s caregiver, I feel very supported by Synergy. Everyone has been so nice and helpful. I’m extremely grateful I connected with Synergy.

resp.text: Thank you Tracey for your kind words!

name: Aleshia Walker
text: Working for SYNERGY has been an extremely positive experience.  The whole organization truly cares about providing quality care and support to each client, and is in this business for all of the right reasons.  They are available 24/7 and work hard to accommodate their clients' scheduling needs.  The office staff truly cares for each client like family and we have wonderful caregivers.  I'm excited to see what the future holds for Synergy HomeCare!

resp.text: Thanks Aleshia, we are blesses to have you on our team.

name: Jenny Hallyburton
text: Synergy has great customer service and the management team has always been helpful. Scott and Lynn are always willing to meet families and answer any questions they may have. I highly recommend this sitter service.

resp.text: Thanks Jenny!

name: Amy Whittenburg
text: My mother is in late stage Alzheimer's and the caregivers have been wonderful with her.  They are very skilled and have the knowledge to deal with my mom on a daily basis.  They bathe, feed, keep her engaged and love on her.  Could not ask for a better company to take care of my mom.

resp.text: Thank you Amy!  We love working with your mom!

name: Lady Te
text:
I will not be with this company much longer due to low pay, plus I found a wonderful family that I will be working for with much better pay. I love what I do and plan on staying in this line of work but love doesn’t pay the bills or put food on the table and clothe my children. I loathe being forced to work overtime just to make ends meet which takes time away from my family. I really do wish things were different because I absolutely love the company and some of the management. I just wish they paid based on experience but they don’t. If you are experienced you will be making the same as someone who has never done this before and are afraid of the elderly. They really do there best to show appreciation for there caregivers and cna’s but trust me, the best thing to do is pay your experienced employees a decent livable wage.

You can bet that whenever you see “competitive wages” on the job application just know that means you will be paid little to nothing and a decent check depends on how desperate you are for the money and if you aren’t desperate enough to do a boat load of overtime then don’t waste your time.

I will say that Scott and Lynn are wonderful people and they are flexible with your shifts so you’ll be able to work what fits you best. Keisha, Kathleen and Santrece are so warm and wonderful to work with.

I’d say this job is great for beginners and students who plan on going into medical. Although we do not provide skilled nursing like a Ltcf it is the basics and allows you to get your feet wet. I love the company but I’ve outgrown it and just because it’s no longer a good fit for me, doesn’t mean I will not recommend this company to reliable people who need work. I’ve already sent some people Synergys’ way.

name: T0785
text: Thank you so much for your great care for our patients and staff at Arbor Springs!

resp.text: Thank you Taresa!

name: Nicole Gachett
text: Awesome staff and great welcoming atmosphere upon entry of the office.

resp.text: Thanks Nicole, you're awsome!

name: Dwayne Long
text: These are some truly amazing people who take  very good measures to insure that you are receiving the best possible care for what is going on and helps you understand all aspects of your care. And it helps that they have a great  attitude and outlook for helping people to understand.

resp.text: Thanks Dwayne!

name: Janine Rumker
text: Right from the very beginning, Shasta from Synergy made us feel welcome and cared for. She was patient and kind with my mother, who recently had a heart attack and had a stent put in. My mother is a caregiver, not used to accepting help and certainly a very proud and private person. She did NOT want any help, certainly not with bathing. Shasta knew just whom to send...Michelle. What a blessing! My mom went from not wanting any help, to wanting to take Michelle with her to her home in Florida! Michelle was so kind and understanding. She did things without being told, was efficient and sweet. I can't say enough good things about our first experience with home care. Thank you so much Synergy!

resp.text:
Janine,
Taking care of your mother was such a blessing. Michelle told us many times how much she enjoyed their time together. We wish the best for your mother in Florida and we will miss her.
Thank you again,
Shasta Kromer

name: venus9 Cotton
text: I have never work there but I heard some good thing's

name: Lady Te
text:
I will not be with this company much longer due to low pay, plus I found a wonderful family that I will be working for with much better pay. I love what I do and plan on staying in this line of work but love doesn’t pay the bills or put food on the table and clothe my children. I loathe being forced to work overtime just to make ends meet which takes time away from my family. I really do wish things were different because I absolutely love the company and some of the management. I just wish they paid based on experience but they don’t. If you are experienced you will be making the same as someone who has never done this before and are afraid of the elderly. They really do there best to show appreciation for there caregivers and cna’s but trust me, the best thing to do is pay your experienced employees a decent livable wage.

You can bet that whenever you see “competitive wages” on the job application just know that means you will be paid little to nothing and a decent check depends on how desperate you are for the money and if you aren’t desperate enough to do a boat load of overtime then don’t waste your time.

I will say that Scott and Lynn are wonderful people and they are flexible with your shifts so you’ll be able to work what fits you best. Keisha, Kathleen and Santrece are so warm and wonderful to work with.

I’d say this job is great for beginners and students who plan on going into medical. Although we do not provide skilled nursing like a Ltcf it is the basics and allows you to get your feet wet. I love the company but I’ve outgrown it and just because it’s no longer a good fit for me, doesn’t mean I will not recommend this company to reliable people who need work. I’ve already sent some people Synergys’ way.

name: Urica Summers
text: I started with Synergy last year it's a great place to work and the staff is very friendly and the schedules are flexible 😊

resp.text: Thanks, Urica!

name: Gretchen McKenzie
text: I have been working for synergy for two years and I love my job and they’re great people to work with.I give five stars to this awesome company!

resp.text: Thank you Gretchen!  We appreciate you so much!

name: Erin Carter
text: Great staff and so compassionate!

resp.text: Thanks Erin!

name: Santrice McClure
text: I start as a caregiver in 2015 when they first open up. I work in the field i absolutely love working for Synergy Home Care and the owners a very understand and i love working with them.

resp.text: You are an awesome caregiver.

name: Bruce Trowbridge
text:
My 94 year old mom fell and fractured her L1 vertebra the day after Christmas.  She was bed ridden for a couple of months due to the pain, and after the fracture healed remained bed ridden and on oxygen due to progressing congestive heart failure.  This lasted almost 6 months until she passed, with the last 4 months under in-home hospice care.  My mom lived with me, since she (and the rest of the family) did not want her last days to be in a nursing home.  I am a single man and with the constant care my mom required, I could not handle it on my own, I needed caregiving help.  I contracted out 60 hours every week for caregiving and I took the other 128 hours myself.

I contracted with BrightStar based on recommendations from friends, and I was not disappointed.   BrightStar provided qualified care givers, and if mom and/or did not relate well with a particular care giver, BrightStar would provide a different one.  We eventually evolved to a core set of 2 regular care givers, loved by my mom and I,  covering all 60 hours per week.  I don’t know if other companies would be this flexible and supportive.  If a regular caregiver could not come, BrightStar would notify me and fill the gap, so that I could always count on a caregiver at my home at the planned schedule.  Knowing that a caregiver will be there, rain or shine, is a major consideration when determining if you want to hire a known private individual or a company with lots of caregivers.  Additionally, BrightStar schedulers, nurse, business office personnel were always a pleasure to work with and very supportive of mom and I during these trying time.  BrightStar may not be the cheapest, but you can count on them, so you just set your hours to what you can afford.  I highly recommend BrightStar, and if the need for caregiving arises for me in the future, I will be calling them.

name: Mary Cashulette
text: I had a horrible infection. This group is unbelievably professional and caring. Christy Jones came up with the idea of using a vac. My surgeon didn’t think about that. I trusted Brightstar more than him and was able to heal well. Thank you so much! Highly recommend!

name: Anna Elizabeth Jones
text: 100% client oriented.

name: Tati Monű
text: Great place great staff and caregivers

resp.text: Thank you!  We are pleased to be able to provide our services to the local, Huntsville community!

name: Steve Howe
text: It’s rare to have a company who does what they say they are going to do, but we sure did with this company. When they said they would send someone out to get a new caregiver started and trained, they did. When a regular caregiver couldn’t come in they made sure a trained caregiver was there even if it was office professionals (who were former caregivers). They made sure we liked our caregiver and if we had complaints they would take care of it. George (the owner) was so personable and spent a lot of time with us explaining his philosophy on running the most honest, best caregiving experience.  We also enjoyed and appreciated our caregivers for my parents. They worked hard and loved them like their own. If we are ever in the position to need a caregiving service in the future, there will be no doubt who we will use, Your Choice Senior Care.

name: Heather Steel
text: I'm very pleased with the service given by Your Choice Senior Care. George and his team are great, and have helped my dad so much. And they have brought me incredible peace-of-mind.  Not only do they bring him breakfast in the morning (he's at Somerby) but they make sure he gets his medicine 3x a day, talk with him (this has helped his speech tremendously) and help him keep up with some of his light chores and ADLs on the days he needs it. We have found them to be super accommodating with last minute changes and requests, and overall very responsive and caring. Thank you!

name: Catherine Hales
text: This team is always very responsive in helping our seniors. George and Christina are extremely helpful in making sure prompt and quality care is always available. They are one of the few home care companies that require extended training for those with memory loss. A much needed training in this field!

name: Debbie Leirer
text: I cannot say enough good things about "Your Choice Senior Care" and I highly recommend them to anyone that needs senior care assistance.  They have been a godsent for my father.  They are very kind, caring and patient as well as very professional.  They were always on-time for their appointments with my father.  They assisted and trained my father with taking his blood sugar readings and insulin injections.  They offer a variety of services and you can pick the service(s) that best suits your needs.  Their prices are very reasonable.  If you need a senior care professional for your elderly parent, "Your Choice Senior Care" is the first call you should make.

name: Richard Davidson
text:
I highly recommend Your Choice Senior Care for anyone needed help caring for somebody. We’ve relied on Your Choice for well over a year to help care for my 97 year old mother. The company’s owners/managers are conscientious, hard-working, and responsive to our concerns.

One caveat: the quality of individual caregivers varies considerably, from excellent too awful. The best are more than caregivers; they are friends, both with my mom and my wife and myself. A rare few were bad enough I ordered them to leave and not return. The owners and managers are careful with who they hire, and pass on our instructions for what is expected from the caregivers, but they cannot monitor everything happening in your home.  In the end, it is up to you to determine which caregivers meets your needs and which have to go.

That said, anytime there has been problem with a caregiver—no matter the time, day or night—the owners/managers have acted *immediately* to correct the problem, including personally caring for my mom until a replacement caregiver was found.  They strive to provide excellent care to the elderly, and their efforts have made it possible for my mom to continue living with us long after she surpassed our ability to care for her by ourselves.

name: Yvonne Simmons
text:
I am helping a friend who lives out of town with his 94 year old Dad.   We chose Your Choice Senior Care about 2 and a half months ago.  Best decision we have made so far.   He has needed 24/7 care up till about a week ago and we cut back to about 10 hrs and the owners helped us figure best times to have the care givers there.
We were so lost when we first realized we needed this type care and they took care of everything even down to picking up supplies.  They are so hands on and involved.
I can go on and on about this being an A+ company!!!!

Yvonne

name: Valeria Farmer
text: The 18 yr old they sent to help with my mother wanted to do nothing but sit there and watch tv.  We stopped using them and they keep sending invoices to be paid that we're already paid.  It's been months since we used them, but keep getting invoices each month.  The last conversation i had with them, i was informed they owe me money but here it is the next month and they want me to pay them again!  They owe us no money and we sure don't owe them!

name: Vanessa
text: The care and compassion my mother received from Your Choice Senior care made me want to write a review to tell others. I have a busy life and wanted her to be taken care of by professional and caring people during the day and while I was on vacation. If you're looking for help, give them a call and they can do many things to make your life easier.

name: Jevon smith
text: They sent me out 45 miles..an the facility dint allow male caregivers there to sit with woman...they promise me i would still get my 9 hours on my check..THEY SENT ME 16$..please. Stay away from them

name: Leigh Wright
text: They were polite and professional. Definitely made a difficult time easier.

name: Leigh Wright
text: They were friendly and professional. Made caring for my grandmother much easier.

name: Valerie Chavez
text: Such great people!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! Look forward to seeing Mrs. Chavez next week!

name: Kaylee Mendyke
text: The owner of this Senior Helpers, Mrs. Mary, is the most caring and compassionate person I know and truly does so much for her employees and clients. I've been working here at Senior Helpers for about a year and a half and it has been an incredible experience to build a relationship with all of the employees and the clients. I love getting the opportunity to make a positive impact on our client's lives each and every day by keeping them strong, happy, and independent.

name: keshia Robinson
text:
Well, I enjoyed working for Senior Helpers at the beginning. You get to pick your schedule but the pay is only 8 dollars which is below minimum wage. Im a retired Air Force cop, so the pay wasnt really an issue for me. I wanted the experience since I am majoring in Nursing and I wanted to get a start in the healthcare career field. During my time, the clients were all sweethearts and I enjoyed them. They were the best part of my day. It really hurt quitting because I just love the clients and that is why I stayed. Well, some improvements for the company is as follows: better training, pay for the training, and raise the pay. When I first got to my orientation I asked how many employees they have? I was told over 100, but looking at their open shifts this company turn over rate is high and they dont have enough employees that care. They would send out available shifts but on the app employees had to use for myself  it wouldn't  show that I had available open shifts. The time off that I requested was always for VA (veterans affairs) appointments so my call in's where emergency only. I was always on time with all clients and I gave every client the best treatment, companion care, and respect.
I dislike the company policies with COVID.  I was schedule to go into the office to do some training. I schedule this on my own because I knew that youtube videos couldnt get me by. I needed hands on training. They lack training. When I confirmed with my boss the time to come in for training I was told by my boss that they are not allowing people to come to the office. She sounded really sick on the phone so I couldnt give you a honest reason why they told employees to stay away. If i had to guess covid. I had called into work last minute for a car issue which i got reprimanded and the second issue was because i needed to make sure a relative didnt have covid because i was around them. I got written up and they told me they would fire me if I called in again. Well. I had to call in again because of covid symptoms. I told the boss if covid symptoms is not a valid excuse for calling into work, then i cant work there. I care about the clients health and if it takes me quitting to protect them I had to. You should not send employees to work or threatened them with termination. Im a hard worker so its really sad to see great people like myself to quit. Lastly, is the driving. I would drive about an 1 hour to get to a clients house. Like i said before I loved the job and I know some caregivers dont do right. They dont clean or take care of the clients like they should. So I stayed because there is not enough good in this work place. All in all it was the company saying I have one more call in and they have to fire me. If im sick i cant be around the elderly. They are vulnerable. They need to rethink their procedures.

Now i dont get unemployment, i cant qualify because i receive the Post 9/11 bill money for school. I cant receive unemployment because i am in school and veterans are not allowed to double dip. Meaning i cant get free money from the Post 9/11 bill and money from unemployment. Like i said before i work because I care.

On a positive these are quotes I picked up:

The price you pay for the job you have

Cold hands, warm heart, dirty sweetheart

Keshia

resp.text:
Keshia, we also enjoyed you working for Senior Helpers. We were very proud to have a veteran join our team. The Federal minimum wage is $7.25 an hour. We do pay our employees this for training pay ONLY but once you complete the hiring process and start working with our clients you receive the wage that was discussed during your interview. We do not have a single employee that is working for less than $8.50 an hour. I pulled your check stubs to make sure we did not make a mistake on your pay while you were employed with Senior Helpers and we did not, if you would like  confirmation on your check stubs we would be happy to provide that information to you please just give us a call at our Senior Helpers office (256)650-2982.
When you started working with Senior Helpers we were shorter staffed due to the pandemic and caregivers quitting without notice or calling in for shifts last minute (without COVID-19 symptoms or being in contact with someone who had COVID-19).
I am sorry you felt we lacked training. We have an entire room in our office dedicated to hands on training that you sat in during our orientation. This training room includes: a medical manikin, hospital bed, shower, shower chair, walker, wheel chair, cane, gait belt, slide board, Hoyer lift, a change of sheets to learn to change an occupied bed, ‘depends’ to practice changing and bathing clients, bed side commode to practice safely transferring clients and more are available to any caregiver who would like additional training to come and schedule a time to practice. We just ask you schedule your time in advance to ensure we have sanitized all materials and your supervisor is available to assist you.
As for our COVID-19 policy that you signed and received a copy of in orientation; we ask if you have been exposed or have any COVID-19 symptoms to call the office and we will send you to the nearest clinic to get tested immediately. Your supervisor actually responded to you when you called out with COVID-19 symptoms, “Of course COVID is an acceptable excuse. And are you going to get tested today? If so just send me the paperwork and it will excuse you.” You told us you were going to get tested but you were going to pass on coming back to work for Senior Helpers because you did not like the call-in policy. We respected your decision and removed you from the schedule and just asked as a courtesy for our clients to let us know your COVID-19 test results so we can update them if they need to be tested in the event you tested positive. You responded stating you do not have COVID-19 and have not been exposed therefore they do not need to be tested.
During your interview you agreed to drive up to 30 miles to a client’s home. The furthest you were asked to drive to a client was 25.7 miles and this was not your regular client.
We thought you were a great a caregiver to our clients in the short time you worked for Senior Helpers and you are right, you did truly care for your clients which we greatly appreciated. I am sorry you felt the need to quit from a misunderstanding you may have had with the attendance policy. We wish you nothing but the best in the future for your nursing career. And if you have any other concerns, we hope you will please call us at our office (256)650-2982 and we will be happy to address this with you.

name: Lydia Avery
text: Every care giver that has come to care for my grandmother has been wonderful! She raves about how much she liked everyone that has come from your company! Which isn't always the case with others who have cared for her in the past. I especially appreciate how flexible Senior Helpers has been with being able to find us last minute care when we unexpectedly needed someone. I am SO GLAD we tried Senior Helpers!! You guys are a major blessing to our lives! Finding quality care is not longer difficult or stressful thanks to Senior Helpers!

name: april Taylor
text: BEWARE!! I would not recommend getting a job here! I was not able to complete orientation due to family issues. Ended up not taking the job. They refused to pay for that one day and was very ugly over the phone. Hung up on me twice! Not professional at all!!! So glad I did not take the job. Their true colors definitely came out! Reporting issue to labor and board first thing Monday morning!

name: Shannon Oakley
text: Senior Helpers has always been so wonderful and easy to work with.  All of their staff is so kind and thoughtful and do a great job every time.  You can always count on them to take care of your loved one and be there for them at all times.

name: Crystal Copney
text: I have been employed with Senior Helpers for 6 years now. I really enjoy the company and my coworkers. They are caring and compassionate.  Mrs. Mary is awesome and goes above and beyond for her employees and clients.

name: Janet Bentley
text: I am very grateful that a good friend recommended Senior Helpers to me.  They stay in touch with me each week and visit quite often to be sure I am happy with the care I receive.  I do not know what we would have done without their excellent service.

name: Kimberly Kennedy
text: Great company 👍

name: Cathy Dianne
text: Nothing but high praise for Mary, Julie and this wonderful team of caring people.  They helped my family through many tough times over the past many years.  Friendly care and multiple services were provided to my mom and we are forever grateful. FIVE* * * * * STARS!!!!

name: Aubrey Smith
text: Senior Helpers is the best home care company out there! Definitely would recommend to everyone!!

name: James Bodie
text: Habitual tardiness, a lack of professionalism, and failure to follow through on timely and important scheduled client care matters makes Senior Helpers a very poor choice for home health care.

resp.text: So sorry that we did not meet your expected criteria. We wish you and your family the best of luck in the future. Mary Jackson/Owner

name: Janet Lammers
text: Very disappointing company. If I could give no stars that would be better. 😕

name: Amanda Cottingham
text: Unprofessional, promised caregivers would show up and they didn’t, overpriced

name: Carleatha Cunningham
text: Visiting Angels is great place to work for. They are very friendly staff and supervisors. I have been with them over 3 years. I wouldn’t trade my job for anything. Best place to work. We also provide the best care your love ones need. We treat them as they are family to us.

name: Stephanie Bennett
text: I've used Visiting Angel's in the care of my 81 year old dad. There was so much genuine care given. I  was glad to see this in this day and age. They were not just there because it was their job but they truly cared about the patient,  the family as well as their duties.  I would recommend  Visiting Angel's to others.

name: Amy Self
text: I started working with visiting Angel's a few weeks ago. The application was easy yet thorough. They try to match caregivers and clients so there is a seamless relationship. I love the company.

name: Elizabeth Boyd
text: Visiting Angels is a wonderful company to work for! Russell is an amazing employer and puts his heart into his company. His compassion and love for our elderly shows in how he runs his company from day to day! He is an advocate for his caregivers that work for him as well as the clients we assist! I have worked for multiple companies in the same capacity in the past but Visiting Angels in Trussville is a step above the rest!

name: David Jones
text: Visiting Angles has been a lifesaver! They have provided great caregivers for my mom and helped us through a difficult time. Special thanks to Russell and Tosha for their great work. They have always been there when we needed them.

resp.text: Thank you so much David! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this 5 star review! We love serving your family!

name: Adrian Wilson
text: This company definitely has your best interest at heart. They care about their employees as much as they care about their clients. I have enjoyed working for this company so far.

name: Matt Johnson
text: Visiting Angels is best provider in the Birmingham area. Russell and his team are true Angels. They have an outstanding team in place to take care of our loved ones.

name: Carolyn Foster
text: Great place to work. I have worked 4 years for them. They are awesome. Office Staff is great.

name: Amy Patton
text: Russell and the staff at Visiting Angels are nothing short of amazing! We personally used Visiting Angels when my mother in law had a brain aneurysm and stroke. The caregivers worked so well with her, encouraged her to complete her physical therapy and were able to take her to doctors appointments and errands around town. They did a great job of matching caregivers that had similar interests. I would recommend Visiting Angels, they are the reason that she has made a full recovery!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review! We loved serving your mother-in-law during her physical therapy!

name: Michelle Ryder
text: Great company.  Caring loving employees that are dedicated to taking the best care of your loved ones.

name: brenda varnado
text: The angel taking care of my mom  andwas gentle understanding. My mom had Alzheimer's it's a very tough desase. she was there for my mom she was there for moms animals and she was there for us. If I had to do it again I would want an angel to come stay with our family

name: James Church Nicholas
text: Very capable staff and very courteous.  They do fantastic work.

resp.text: Thank you so much James! We appreciate you!

name: Susan Humphreys
text: Great place to work. Very rewarding  placing caregivers in client's home that have a passion to work with geriatrics and hearing how pleased the clients are when we take care of their loved ones.

resp.text: Thank you very much Susan! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a 5-star review!

name: Logan Deen
text: I personally know Russell, who is the owner of Visiting Angels. The passion he has for his business rivals none, and he truly cares about his clients! I highly recommend Visiting Angels!

name: Brent Nail
text: Visiting Angels is a great and trustworthy company. I highly recommend them for any home hospice or bedside caregiver needs.

name: Robert Mills
text: Russell and his team are top notch. If you’re looking for honesty and caring people, look no further than Visiting Angels.

resp.text: Thank you very much!

name: Pat Boyd
text: I personally know some of the staff and they go above and beyond taking care of their clients. Great place!

name: Bridget Baughan
text: I know Russell personally and have no hesitation recommending him or his company Visiting Angels.  He is a very honest, sincere individual and you can't go wrong using his services.

resp.text: Thank you Bridget! We are so grateful you would take the time to write us a review!

name: Brice Jackson
text: I cannot day enough about Visiting Angels! Top top senior care! Great staff! Highly professional! Glad Visiting Angels is in our area of Alabama!

resp.text: Thank you very much Brice! We appreciate you!

name: Tosha Pritt
text: Wonderful place to work!!! Amazing compassionate caregivers and office staff  always willing to go the extra mile for the families we serve!!

resp.text: Thank you very much for taking the time to leave us this wonderful review! We really appreciate you sharing your experience with others!

name: Tmya Cunningham
text: Thanks for taking great care of me and my newborn.

name: Sandra Shaw
text: Great company to work for with very flexible hours to fit any schedule. Phenomenal boss that helps make working for his company pleasant!

resp.text: Thank you, Sandra!

name: lester barnes
text: The caregivers at Visiting Angels Trussville give the agency its name for sure.  Could not ask for better care giving for my mother and father.

resp.text: Thank you very much Lester!

name: Keondra Cunningham
text: Great experience and amazing staff

name: Devon Payne
text: Great Service and friendly staff

name: Jeremy Patton
text: Took care of my mother. Very professional and friendly. The whole experience was great.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Patton! We appreciate you!

name: Quentin Dunn
text: Russel goes above and beyond for his client.

resp.text: Thank you, Quentin!

name: _KHLOE BOYD_
text: LOVE MY JOB ITS AWESOME!!!

resp.text: Thank you Ebony :)

name: Jacob Buffington
text: Great office!

resp.text: Thank you Jacob!
